de.esoco.lib.security

Interface AuthenticationService

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ModificationSyncService

    public interface AuthenticationService
    Definition of services that perform user authentication based on data in a relatable object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean authenticate(org.obrel.core.Relatable rAuthData)
      Authenticates an entity based on the data in the relatable argument.

    • Method Detail

      • authenticate

        boolean authenticate(org.obrel.core.Relatable rAuthData)
        Authenticates an entity based on the data in the relatable argument. The relations of the authentication data object must contain the parameters necessary to perform the authentication. What exactly these parameters are depends on the service implementation. For the most basic type of a password authentication the argument should contain of the relations SecurityRelationTypes.LOGIN_NAME and SecurityRelationTypes.PASSWORD. Alternatively the types SecurityRelationTypes.CREDENTIAL or SecurityRelationTypes.BINARY_CREDENTIAL may be used (either with or without a login name).

        Implementations may also choose to use different data for the authentication in which case the required parameters must be documented for the callers. They can also use the relatable argument to return addition information if they need to, e.g. a session ID or authentication token.

        Parameters:
        rAuthData - The relatable object containing the authentication data
        Returns:
        TRUE if the authentication was successful, FALSE if not
